The plant produces yellow to golden flowers in dense, cylindrical spikes, which bloom during the rainy season. Its seeds are encased in elongated, woody pods that split open to release the seeds. Acacia oxyclada is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often used for its hardy nature and potential medicinal properties.
